title: Perspective
author: Michael T
description: So, meet Samuel Pozzi, a fashionable Parisian doctor of the late 19th century, the father of modern gynecology and a legendary womanizer; in a word, the same “man in red” depicted in the famous portrait by Sargent “Doctor Pozzi at home”. Through the prism of the doctor's journey, supplied with a letter of recommendation from Sargent to Henry James, to Foggy Albion, Barnes examines the Belle Époque (Belle Epoque) in all its diversity, and the reader cannot help but draw disturbing parallels with today. Moreover, the doctor is not alone: the refined aristocrats Prince de Polignac and Count Robert de Montesquieu - the prototype of Baron de Charlus from Proust's epic "At the Jokes of the Wasted Hour" - keep company with him.
